newsitem.title: HONG KONG: AsiaSat signs US$250 mln loan term loan facility.
newsitem.headline: AsiaSat signs US$250 mln loan term loan facility.

text.p: Asia Satellite Telecommunications Co Ltd has signed a US$250 million term loan facility with 12 banks, arrangers of the facility said Thursday.
AsiaSat's major shareholders are Hong Kong's Hutchison Whampoa Ltd, Britain's Cable & Wireless Plc and Beijing's state-owned flagship China International Trust and Investment Corp (CITIC).

The company owns and operates two geostationary communications satellites offering telecommuncations, broadcasting and private network services from Siberia to Australia and from Japan to the Middle East.
The facility follows the global offer for sale of AsiaSat's ultimate holding company, Asia Satellite Holdings Ltd, which was completed in June of this year.
Shares are now traded in New York and Hong Kong.
Lead arrangers of the loan are Fuji Bank, HSBC Investment Bank Asia, J.P. Morgan Securities Asia and Paribas Asia.
The facility has a tenor of 7.5 years. The margin will be based on the issuer's debt ratio, varying from 0.55 to 1.2 percent over the London Interbank Offered Rate, bankers said earlier this year.
They said underwriting fees are 15 basis points and management fees are 47.5 basis points, while there is a commitment fee of 37.5 basis points.
Proceeds of the loan will be used to refinance the borrower's existing debts and for general working capital.
Other participants in the loan are as follows:
Bayerische Landesbank Girozentrale, Cho Hung Bank and ING Lease Structured Finance are arrangers.
CIBC CEF and Sakura Bank are co-arrangers.
Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Hong Kong branch and Industrial Bank of Japan Hong Kong branch are lead managers.
De Nationale Investeringsbank Asia is senior manager.
